comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The woman on this photo is not Mrs. Rutherford Stuyvesant, it's May Palmer Depew, the wife of Chauncey M. Depew (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chauncey_Depew). As I searched for photos of Mrs. Rutherford Stuyvesant in the newspapers, I found one (in The Salt Lake tribune., July 20, 1913, Second News Section, Image 13), but it has not much similarity, but another photo on the same page has: this of Mrs. Depew, with the same hair jewelry. The same photos are in The Washington herald., July 20, 1913, Page 5. Other photos of May Palmer Depew, p.e. in The San Francisco call., March 16, 1902, Image 3 prove that not the newspapers mixed up the photos, but the Bain agency. I presume that this photo was taken long before 1915. There are other Bain photos of Mrs. Depew which had been taken later, p.e. see also comments there Other comments are on

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Trying to find a clinching portrait of the former May Palmer (Mrs Chauncey Depew as of December 1901: The San Francisco call., December 28, 1901, Page 3, top center chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1901-12-28/ed-... The San Francisco call., October 26, 1901, Image 5, col 3 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85066387/1901-10-26/ed-... Unfortunately, the picture at www.ebay.co.uk/itm/Printed-photo-Chauncey-Depew-marriage-... is too small to be helpful.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This picture of the Depew/Palmer wedding gets close. The aspect of pictures of May Palmer Depew that has been puzzling me is her waistline -- but this wedding photo has the same corseted look as the Bain picture B-59 thinks is mis-identified as Mrs. Stuyvesant. I agree with B-59 that the picture is taken earlier, probably 1901-1902 (whichever woman it is, since their marriages were close in time).
